title: TE Ryan Biese et al. v. Tennessee Valley Presbytery
parties: TE Ryan Biese et al. v. Tennessee Valley Presbytery
source: Case 2023-04: TE Ryan Biese et al. v. Tennessee Valley Presbytery, M51GA, 2024, 2043-2045
tags: Complaints, Review and Control, Sabbath, Westminster Standards, Church, Governance, Session, Authority of
summary: Complainants allege that Presbytery erred when it approved without exception on October 8, 2022 the minutes of the Session of Redeemer Church (Knoxville) from January 26, 2021, and thereby declined to cite the Session with an exception of substance for these minutes. Complainants further allege that Presbytery subsequently erred when it denied a Complaint brought against Presbytery for its approval of these minutes. The language from these Session minutes in question reads as follows, “The youth group will have an outdoor Super Bowl party on Feb. 7 .” On October 8, 2022, Presbytery’s Committee for Review of Sessional Records recommended that Presbytery cite Session with an exception of substance . Presbytery thereupon acted to “remove [this] item from the motion” and “approve[d] without exception the January 26, 2021 minutes of Redeemer Church (Knoxville) .”
